text:
httpd-2.2.0-win32-src-rev2.zip on a winXP and MS Visual Studio 2005

in the file ssl_expr_parse.c
on line 925 (or near) there is this code:

int ssl_expr_yyparse(void)
#else
int ssl_expr_yyparse();
#endif
#endif

the semicolon causes an error, removing continue
the compilation.

Kapitan
creator: aric81@inwind.it

text:
The bug is not in httpd, the bug is in your bison parser or it's
yacc compatibility plugin.  Please try upgrading or downgrading
your installed version of bison.
creator: wrowe@apache.org

text:
I use bison 2.1-1 from cygwin.
Maybe it's a parser bug, but the
rest is parsed fine.

Thanks for answer.
creator: aric81@inwind.it
